intro: Nepeta amethystina, commonly known as purple catmint, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale lavender to deep purple. Its leaves are typically gray-green and emit a minty scent when crushed. Nepeta amethystina is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
